passages.text: EQUITY: CONSUMER RELATED
Weak 1H25 results on sluggish home furnishings demand; maintain Neutral

Weak 1H25 results; await property sector recoveryOppein Home Group reported a set of weak 1H25 results on 29 Aug, below our expectations. In 1H25, the company delivered revenue of CNY8.24bn, down \(4.0\%\) y- y, with attributable net profit of CNY1.02bn, up \(2.9\%\) y- y. We believe the slower-than- expected sales performance reflects sluggish home furnishing demand and limited progress from channel transformation; in detail: (1) the government trade- in subsidies provided little uplift for Oppein, with most categories declining again off a low base; (2) although the net reduction of stores narrowed in 1H25 compared with 2024, closures still weighed on revenue. On a positive note, profitability was supported by an improved channel mix and tighter cost control, offsetting impact from weaker investment income, leading to a 0.8pp y- y improvement in net margin to \(12.4\%\) .

Revenue likely to stay under pressure in the near termLooking ahead, we believe Oppein's revenue is likely to remain under pressure in the near term, as (1) government subsidies appear more effective for soft furnishings than for customized furniture in terms of stimulating end consumer demand; (2) the company's ongoing channel restructuring has yet to deliver clear results. Against the backdrop of weaker new and secondary home transactions, we do not expect a meaningful recovery in 2H25F, though the degree of pressure may ease slightly compared with 1H25. Profitability should also face some headwinds, as external operating conditions show little signs of improvement, in our view. Over the medium- to long term, we think Oppein's recovery will hinge on both property sales stabilization and the effectiveness of the company's channel reform strategy.

Reduce target price to CNY53.00 and keep Neutral ratingWe reduce FY25F- 27F revenue/earnings estimates by \(5 - 6\% /8 - 9\%\) , respectively, to reflect the slower- than- expected revenue growth in 1H25. We cut our target forward- 12- month P/E to 12.5x (from 15.0x previously), roll- forward our valuation date by six- months, and arrive at our new, lower, target price of CNY53.00 (from CNY69.20); our target price implies downside of \(4\%\) . Oppein currently trades at a FY25F P/E of 13.3x (EPS: CNY4.17), which is fair in our view, considering the company's lukewarm earnings growth trajectory (FY24- 27F earnings CAGR of \(0.3\%\) ).

Oppen is a customized- furniture manufacturer with headquarter in Gengzhou, Guangdong province. The company has four main product types, namely wardrobes, kitchen cabinets, bathroom products and wooden floors.
Our target price of CNY53.00 is based on 12.5x end- FY2P/E. The benchmark index for the stock is the CSI300 Index.

Downside risks include: 1) gross margin may fuhin trend down driven by rising raw material costs and 2) expansion into home renovation channels; upside risks include better- than- expected sales recovery in 2H24- FY25F.

Oppen is a POE custom- furniture manufacturer with its headquarter in Guangzhou, Guangdong province. Oppen's current chairman is Mr. Yao Liangsong. The biggest shareholder of Oppen is Mr. Yao Liangsong with \(66.2\%\) shareholding (as of end- June 2022). There are seven members on the board of Oppen, with three being independent directors. Oppen has: 1) strengthened quality management in its production and operations process, and 2) provided environmental- friendly projects to consumers.

A rating of 'Buy', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to outperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Neutral', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to perform in line with the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Reduce', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to underperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Suspended', indicates that the rating, target price and estimates have been suspended temporarily to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies. A 'Neutral' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to perform in line with the Benchmark during the next 12 months. A 'Bearish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to underperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months. The achievement of any target price may be impeded by general market and macroeconomic trends, and by other risks related to the company or the market, and may not occur if the company's earnings differ from estimates.
